meanings.sent1: After a long run, his inhauls were deep and steady.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the importance of slow inhauls and exhales.
meanings.sent3: During the yoga class, the instructor exaggerated her inhauls for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The inhauls of fresh mountain air filled her lungs with renewed energy.
meanings.sent5: The inhauls of the crisp morning air invigorated him for the day ahead.

meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed herbal inhauls to help clear her sinuses.
meanings.sent2: The toxic fumes were dangerous inhauls for the workers in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The inhauls of the sweet aroma from the bakery made her crave pastries.
meanings.sent4: His inhauls of knowledge from books shaped his understanding of the world.
meanings.sent5: The inhauls of fresh sea breeze brought a sense of calm to the beachgoers.

meanings.definition: Inhauls: to breathe in air or another substance
meanings.sent1: She inhauls deeply before blowing out the birthday candles.
meanings.sent2: The hiker paused to inhauls the scent of pine trees in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The comedian pretended to inhauls helium to make his voice squeaky.
meanings.sent4: He inhauls the aroma of freshly baked bread as he enters the bakery.
meanings.sent5: The diver inhauls a big gulp of air before plunging into the deep ocean.
